section.title: Non Contiguous VLAN Ranges
section.para: &PRODUCT; provides you with the flexibility to add non contiguous VLAN ranges to your network. The administrator can either update an existing VLAN range or add multiple non contiguous VLAN ranges while creating a zone. You can also use the UpdatephysicalNetwork API to extend the VLAN range.

listitem.para: Log in to the CloudPlatform UI as an administrator or end user.
Ensure that the VLAN range does not already exist.
Check whether the new VLAN range overlaps with any existing ones. If overlaps, extend the existing range. If does not overlap, add the new range.
In the left navigation, choose Infrastructure. On Zones, click View More, then click the zone to which you want to work with.
In the Guest node of the diagram, click Configure.

Click Add VLAN Ranges button
add-vlan-ico.png: button to add a VLAN range.
The Add VLAN Ranges dialog is displayed.
Specify the start and end of the VLAN range.
